info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 11:51AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mariposa, northeastern Madera and northeastern Fresno Counties through 1215 PM PDT... At 1149 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm near Oakhurst, or 10 miles southwest of Yosemite South Entrance, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could cause additional flooding. Locations impacted include... Yosemite South Entrance, Oakhurst, Clover Meadow Wilderness Office, Metcalf Gap, Mariposa Grove, Batterson, Green Mtn, Bass Lake Ranger District, Buck Camp Ranger Station, Chilkoot Meadow, Fish Camp, Graveyard Meadow, Poison Ridge and Ahwahnee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
